title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

ai.summary: Based on the available description… Daniel Tom, 31, owns Bay Area Sanitation and manages a fleet of almost 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025; the piece was produced for CNBC Make It by Mickey Todiwala and team.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, 31, founder/operator of Bay Area Sanitation
Service area: construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area
Produced for CNBC Make It (credits: Mickey Todiwala, Beatriz Bajuelos, Alisa Stern, Tom Huddleston Jr., Kathy Mavrikakis)
takeaways: Asset-heavy, regionally focused operations can scale to multimillion-dollar revenue—measurements of unit count and regional penetration matter for capacity planning.
Managing a large physical fleet across a metro area underscores the importance of logistics, maintenance scheduling, and route optimization.
Concentrated, local markets (construction sites/events) can provide predictable demand patterns useful for forecasting and operational budgeting.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video highlights route planning made easy as Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups. It positions Copilot Groups within Microsoft Copilot as a tool related to organizing or simplifying route-planning tasks.
bullets: Route planning made easy is the central message.
Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups.
Presented by the Microsoft Copilot channel.
takeaways: Microsoft is highlighting Copilot Groups for route-planning scenarios—monitor this feature for potential operational relevance.
Decision-makers with field operations or maintenance routes should consider evaluating Copilot Groups in future pilots or vendor briefings.
Track developments around Copilot Groups to assess fit with existing routing and coordination workflows.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG Poland’s podcast episode features Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discussing how AI is already embedded in audit work, from automating repetitive tasks to enabling analysis of full data populations. They outline specific tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), benefits for clients, required auditor competencies, and implementation challenges including data security and regulation.
bullets: AI supports repetitive audit tasks and large-scale data analysis, shifting from sampling to full-population review.
KPMG tools highlighted: AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI (conversational assistants/agents), KPMG Clara platform and Clara for Clients.
AI aids documentation, disclosure analysis, real-time engagement management, and client communication.
Adoption changes the auditor’s role and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Key challenges include data security, regulatory environment, and managing AI-related risks.
takeaways: Ensure comprehensive, timely data capture and integration to enable full-population audits and real-time oversight.
Prioritize secure data handling and compliance controls to meet regulatory expectations around AI-driven audits.
Plan for upskilling and change management to interact effectively with AI tools and support audit automation.
Evaluate vendor tools and platforms (e.g., KPMG Clara) for capabilities around real-time management and client communication.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator of Endfield Industries, and the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings with DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield launch trailer emphasizes NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Game described as a 3D real-time strategy RPG starring the Endministrator of Endfield Industries.
Trailer capture details: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra Settings, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Official game page and NVIDIA DLSS 4 feature link provided in description.
Social channels for Arknights: Endfield and NVIDIA GeForce listed for follow-up.
takeaways: The launch trailer uses DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation, indicating adoption of NVIDIA's latest upscaling/AI frame-generation tech in commercial releases.
Trailer capture on an RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra suggests modern launches are leveraging high-end GPU hardware for marketing and capture.
Decision-makers should note the inclusion of DLSS 4 in the release materials when specifying GPU compatibility and support for client systems or capture/streaming workflows.
